result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendron Romal Bolden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *  Pay restitution in the amount of $199.65 to MPD by December 22, 2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment;
*  Pay all costs and surcharges by December 22, 2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*  No contact with WTMJ at 720 W Capitol Drive;
*  Successfully complete a course in anger management;

timeConds.notes: *  Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; sentence stayed and to be used at the discretion of the agent;

Case scheduled for final pretrial. Defendant failing to appear.  On State's motion,  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court vacates jury trial date of 1-11-2015.  NO BAIL TO BE FORFEITED.

Defendant Kendron Romal Bolden in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
For reasons stated on the record, defense requests an adjourned jury trial date.  Court grants request and vacates jury trial date of 12-02-2015.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Bail motion by the defense. Arguments heard.  Court removed the defendant from Justice Point supervision due to the defendant not residing in Milwaukee County.  Court ordered the defendant to inform the Court within 24 hours if he begins to reside in Milwaukee again so that Justice Point can be re-ordered.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Kendron Romal Bolden in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel newly appointed, and still needs discovery.  For reasons stated on the record, the case will remain scheduled for 10/15/2015 at 1:30pm for final pre-trial, but the Court vacated the 11/30/2015 jury trial. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

The defendant came to court on today's date (08/27/2015) at 1:30pm.  Defendant showed the clerk his orange slip. The orange slip told the defendant to appear on 08/27/2015 at 1:30, which appears incorrect as Branch 23 is down on the afternoon of this date.
After looking in CCAP, the correct date of the defendant's next court date is 08/31/2015 at 1:30pm.  Clerk informed him of this court date, made a copy of the defendant's orange slip, and wrote the correct court date of the orange slip before returning it to the defendant.

Copy of the defendant's orange slip received and filed.
